results.title: ‘Code Blue’: A Brooklyn I.C.U. Fights for Each Life in a Coronavirus Surge
results.abstract: Nearly every patient was on a ventilator. Some were in their 80s, some in their 30s. Medical workers were falling fast and had to be resourceful — “the alternative,” one said, “is death.”

results.title: Coronavirus Live Updates: New Jersey and New Orleans Among New U.S. Hot Spots; Top U.S. Officials Warn of ‘Our Pearl Harbor’
results.abstract: Almost 8,500 of the U.S.’s reported 310,000 coronavirus patients have died, and governors are hunting for scarce ventilators. A carrier captain removed after drawing attention to a shipboard outbreak is infected. In Finland, a stockpile dating to the Cold War proves timely.

results.title: Daily Death Toll in N.Y. Sees a One-Day Drop, Cuomo Says: Live Updates
results.abstract: New York State reported 630 new deaths on Saturday, but 594 on Sunday. The governor cautioned that it could be a “blip.”

results.title: Italy’s Virus Shutdown Came Too Late. What Happens Now?
results.abstract: Italy underestimated the spread of the virus at first. These maps show why the country’s nationwide lockdown came too late to contain it.

results.title: Finland, ‘Prepper Nation of the Nordics,’ Isn’t Worried About Masks
results.abstract: Unlike their neighbors, the Finns never stopped stockpiling after the Cold War. Now Finland sits on an enviable supply of medical and survival gear in the Covid-19 era.
results.byline: By Christina Anderson and Henrik Pryser Libell

results.title: How New Jersey’s First Coronavirus Patient Survived
results.abstract: James Cai’s case was completely new to his doctors. When he grew severely ill, he tapped a network of Chinese and Chinese-American medical colleagues who helped save his life.

results.title: How a Pharmacist on the Front Lines Spends Her Sundays

results.title: To Safeguard Its Future, Tennis Seeks Unity. Even With the French Open.
results.abstract: As play is delayed to at least mid-July, small tournaments and many players are at risk of significant financial losses, and the French Open’s unilateral rescheduling has added to the chaos.

multimedia.caption: The Wimbledon cancellation on Wednesday made it clear that the rest of the tennis season was in doubt.

results.title: Anything for Dinner Is OK
results.abstract: Sometimes it’s nice to cook what you want: Hopefully, that’s chicken piccata, spicy sheet-pan sausage and squash, or an easy tagliatelle.

results.title: How Do You Make a Less Toxic Blue Dye? Start With Red Beets
results.abstract: Usually these root vegetables cause pink stains, but with a little bit of chemistry, Brazilian researchers found they could produce another hue.

multimedia.caption: This blue pigment was made with a compound that naturally occurs in beets and contributes to their red coloring.

results.title: Cannabis Scientists Are Chasing the Perfect High
results.abstract: Chemists at some of the biggest legal-weed companies are after an elusive prize: a predictable, reliable product.

results.title: The Coronavirus Patients Betrayed by Their Own Immune Systems
results.abstract: A “cytokine storm” becomes an all-too-frequent phenomenon, particularly among the young. But treatments are being tested.

results.title: The Spiky Blob Seen Around the World
results.abstract: How C.D.C. medical illustrators created the coronavirus pandemic’s most iconic image.
